channel.title: I found this by searching google and I think you limewire users might like it
channel.description:
hey guys for those of you switching from communist p2p software like limewire, frostwire ect... Here is a torrent article on how to spot a fake torrent. http://netforbeginners.about.com/od/peersharing/tp/how_to_tell_if_a_torrent_is_fake.htm
Tell me what you guys think :P

item.title: I found this by searching google and I think you limewire users might like it
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

1. Confirm Both the Torrent and the Movie Release Date
Means nothing if know where to look. I have gotten 2 movies before the release date. Theater's get watermarked copies to watch. If an employee is sneaky enough to get it home, he can get a copy of it.
9. Trackers that Can't Be Found on Google
You can remove these from each download via properties. (In UTorrent)
10. Only Use the Following Media Players
All media players are at risk actually. The problem is not the media player itself, its that people download it from bad locations. I suggest, download it from the creator, if possible. Sometimes, like i have seen Microsoft do, they will put it on downloads.com or some other file-hosting website.

Just watch what your doing, that is all common sense. Also, a tip, have a anti-virus that keeps an eye on new files as well. EX: AVG Free. I know its not the best, but it does check all downloaded files.

Read full topic
